channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tuesday Briefing
item.description: Here’s what you need to know.

item.title: China premier says he’s ‘fully confident’ country’s sluggish economy will hit 5% growth target as stimulus grows
item.description: Beijing has set a growth target of around five percent for 2024, but in the third quarter the country saw its slowest expansion in a year and a half.

item.title: Israeli or Palestinian, U.S. Voters in the West Bank Say Biden Let Them Down
item.description: Tens of thousands of U.S. citizens live in the Israeli-occupied territory, on opposing sides of an entrenched conflict, where neither Palestinians nor...

item.title: How Trump Media’s Stock Could Swing After the Election
item.description: No stock is more directly linked to the outcome than Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social.

item.title: Russian and Other Groups May Try to Undermine U.S. Elections After Vote
item.description: Groups from Russia and other countries could continue to stoke political discord until the election is certified in January, intelligence agencies say...

item.title: Meta extends political ad ban beyond Election Day
item.description: It didn't offer a reason. But one can guess.

item.title: Sydney to Become Seventh World Major Marathon in 2025
item.description: The Sydney Marathon has joined the ranks of New York, Boston, Chicago, London, Berlin and Tokyo, receiving a designation reserved for the most elite r...

item.title: ‘I haven’t seen sunlight in 3 months’: American law firm trainees in London endure 13-hour days for eye-watering six-figure starting salaries
item.description: Law firm trainees need to be ready to take calls at odd hours, weekends, and while on vacation—but they mint up to £170,000 a year doing it.

item.title: Wall Street Financiers Queue Up for a Chance at Billions in Saudi Oil Cash
item.description: Are you an international business titan on the hunt for billions of dollars of Saudi oil cash? Prepare for “a mind game.”

item.title: Kamala Harris’s housing plan is the most aggressive since post-World War II boom, experts say
item.description: “Our lack of affordable housing will continue to depress savings, opportunity, and growth in ways that will do long-term harm to the nation’s economy....

item.title: Bitcoin and Crypto, Promoted by Trump, Brace for Election Volatility
item.description: Many crypto investors hope that a victory for Donald Trump could propel the price of Bitcoin to new heights, though a loss could cause a fall.

item.title: How Kemi Badenoch Became Leader of the UK Conservative Party
item.description: Ms. Badenoch’s ascent is partly the result of a deliberate diversifying of the party under David Cameron in the 2000s. In her politics, she exemplifie...

item.title: How Stock, Bond and Currency Markets Could Respond to the Election
item.description: Investors are considering the candidates’ policies and historical trends to bet on where stocks, bonds and currencies are headed.

item.title: Hundreds of German workers on a 4-day workweek trial got better sleep, more exercise, and felt less stress than their 5-day peers
item.description: German workers gave hair samples and wore smartwatches to gauge the health benefits of a shortened working week.

item.title: How Kemi Badenoch Became Leader of the UK Conservative Party
item.description: Ms. Badenoch’s ascent is partly the result of a deliberate diversifying of the party under David Cameron in the 2000s. In her politics, she exemplifie...
